body_html:
That's impossible to do in the wrapper; I think one would have to add a new GRUCell type to get this behavior.
…
On Tue, Aug 15, 2017 at 11:54 AM, davidhstern ***@***.***> wrote: FWIW, I found that simply applying regular dropout to the c tensor in the GRUCell gives good results, as suggested by the paper linked above. Obviously this meant modifying the GRUCell. I am not sure how to do it in the wrapper. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. GRUCell type to get this behavior.
…

 GRUCell gives good results, as suggested by the paper linked above.
 Obviously this meant modifying the GRUCell. I am not sure how to do it in

body:
That's impossible to do in the wrapper; I think one would have to add a new
GRUCell type to get this behavior.

On Tue, Aug 15, 2017 at 11:54 AM, davidhstern <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> FWIW, I found that simply applying regular dropout to the c tensor in the
> GRUCell gives good results, as suggested by the paper linked above.
> Obviously this meant modifying the GRUCell. I am not sure how to do it in
> the wrapper.
>
> —
